item.title: Visible Ink Valley
item.description:
Wednesday, June 5, 2013, 12 – 5pm



Visible Ink Valley offers a range of spaces such as a rehearsal room, meeting room, public computer room and art space which can be used free of charge for a variety of projects. Visible Ink is currently being used for comedy performances, sustainable clothing workshops, acting workshops, arts and craft classes, circus workshops and much more. Visible Ink Valley is a versatile, vibrant and creative space that provides young people with the resources and opportunity to grow and engage with Brisbane city.

Cost: free
Bookings: contact 3403 0136
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.description:
St John's Anglican College Junior Campus - 2 Alpine Place, Forest Lake
Saturday, June 22, 2013, 10am – 12pm



Throw yourself into the fun and engaging world of pottery. Experienced artists will guide you through the techniques of pottery wheel throwing and handsculpting. Find muscles you never knew you had in the physical and fun activity.

Cost: 5
Bookings: Bookings required. Please call 0411 246 487 to book your place.
Meeting point: Please meet at the under croft
Requirements: Please ensure you wear clothes you can get a bit messy in.
Age: 10-17

item.title: StreetWise Learn To Skate Workshops - Beginners
item.description:
Paddington Skatepark, Neal Macrossan Playground Park,
14 Caroline St, Paddington QLD 4064
Sunday, June 23, 2013, 9 – 11am



StreetWise Learn To Skate Workshops and Events is a fun, healthy and physical activity taught by dedicated Australia Sports Commission accredited skateboarders within the local scene. All equipment is provided such as skateboards and safety gear and activity is free. This activity is perfect for kids who have never skateboarded before and want to give it a go, or just to improve your skills and learn a few basic tricks.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings Required. Please call 07 55 757 808 to book your place.
Meeting point: Please meet at the skate park
Requirements: Please wear a hat, sunscreen, sturdy footwear.
Age: 10-17

item.title: Come and try Canoeing
item.description:
Monday, June 24, 2013, 9am – 12pm



Canoeing in one or more of the many waterways Brisbane has to offer. People will learn how to use the craft in a safe manner and discover what an active and enjoyable recreational activity.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings required. Please call 07 3349 1933 to book your place.
Meeting point: Please meet at the large boat ramp. Just look for the canoe trailer.
Requirements: Please wear clothes that can get wet, closed in shoes that can get wet, a hat, and bring sunscreen, a change of clothes, a towel, and any personal medication you may need.
Age: 10-17
Venue: Sinbad Street Boat Ramp
Venue address: Sinbad Street, Sandgate

Come experience the fitness craze that is taking the world by storm! With an infectious blend of Latin and international rhythms and easy to follow moves Zumba boasts a global following of millions. Why? It's FUN, it's easy , it's different, it's effective.

item.title: Morning Yoga
item.description:
Monday, June 24, 2013, 10 – 11:30am



The aim of this yoga workshop is to create an experience where participants leave feeling empowered, inspired, grounded and present to their infinite abundance of creative potential. Through a vinyasa style practice of asana (postures), pranayama and meditation, participants will be supported through the postures by our friendly and encouraging yoga teacher, Ella. Living life with intention, vibrancy, vitality and freedom to transform one’s awareness of the world.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings for this workshop will be taken via email -visibleinkvalley@brisbane.qld.gov.au
Requirements: You may want to bring a drink bottle. Fruit and water will be provided.
Age: 10-17
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.title: Photography Basics & Walking Tour
item.description:
Monday, June 24, 2013, 10 – 11:30am



We will be exploring using your eye to discern the world before you and understand the principles of what makes a photo work. Composition, colour, lighting, contrast, line, shape. We will explore the foundations of art and design so that anyone can go home and play with the tools they have available to create impressive shots. This tour of photography basics will be followed by a walking tour of Fortitude Valley, to allow the participants the space to explore what it is they want to photograph and how to capture truth and beauty in their immediate surroundings. We can put our new skills to practice and discover the potential in all of our photographers.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings for this workshop will be taken via email -visibleinkvalley@brisbane.qld.gov.au
Requirements: Please bring a hat for the walking tour as well as a drink bottle. Fruit and water will be provided.
Age: 10-17
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.title: Scooter Skills
item.description:
Deagon Skate Park, 106 Kempster St, Deagon
Monday, June 24, 2013, 10 – 11am



Active School Travel (AST) is a Brisbane City Council travel behaviour change program targeted at primary schools. This world leading program aims to promote sustainable, safe and healthy school travel modes such as walking, cycling, scootering, public transport and carpooling. The AST program invites you to participate in a Scooter Skills Training program during the school holidays. This FREE one-hour training session will be delivered by professional scooter coaches and will cover simple scooter and helmet safety check, basic control and riding manoeuvers, safety and footpath etiquette, school rules applying to use and behaviour.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings required. Please call 0414 752 800 between 9.30-4.30, Monday - Friday to book your place.
Meeting point: Please meet at the Pro Scooter lessons tent
Requirements: Participants will need a scooter and a helmet. PSL can supply some scooters and helmets if needed. Please negotiate this when booking your place. It is preferred that participants wear protective knee and elbow pads if you have some.
Age: 10-17
item.xCal:location: Deagon Skate Park, 106 Kempster St, Deagon

item.description:
Monday, June 24, 2013, 10:30am – 12:30pm



Our trained leaders will organise co-operative, non-competitive fun games and activities, which can involve people of most ages and abilities. Utilising our exciting range of equipment, like our giant earth ball, boffas hocket, fun parachute, fireman toss mate, tug of war, sack races, mad hoppers and lots more. This program is fun, exciting and guaranteed a laugh for the young and the young at heart! Suitable for ages 4yrs to adult.

Requirements: Have a great day. You may want to bring along a water bottle for this activity.

item.description:

item.title: Parkour
item.description:
Monday, July 1, 2013, 10am – 3:30pm



Parkour is encompassed by a set of principles combined with a way of moving within your environment and overcoming obstacles of any kind, be they physical or mental. The physical aspect of Parkour involves practical movement techniques such as running, crawling, jumping, climbing, and other methods of catching yourself, grabbing and hanging, rolling and balancing, applied to all environments both urban and natural. Visible Ink will be running a full day workshop on the basics of Parkour in partnership with the Australian Parkour Association – Brisbane. The workshops will cover an introduction to Parkour; its principles, fundamental movements and training techniques, as well as strength, conditioning and fitness basics. Classes have a strong emphasis on safety – which is why only participants over the age of 12 are accepted.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings for this workshop will be taken via email - visibleinkvalley@brisbane.qld.gov.au - Only young people over the age of 12 can participate in this activity.
Requirements: You may want to bring a drink bottle. Please bring lunch, as it is not supplied. Fruit and water will be provided.
Age: 12-17
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.title: Scooter Skills
item.description:
Kuraby Skate Park, Wally Park, Beenleigh Road, Kuraby QLD
Monday, July 1, 2013, 10 – 11am



Active School Travel (AST) is a Brisbane City Council travel behaviour change program targeted at primary schools. This world leading program aims to promote sustainable, safe and healthy school travel modes such as walking, cycling, scootering, public transport and carpooling. The AST program invites you to participate in a Scooter Skills Training program during the school holidays. This FREE one-hour training session will be delivered by professional scooter coaches and will cover simple scooter and helmet safety check, basic control and riding manoeuvers, safety and footpath etiquette, school rules applying to use and behaviour.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings required. Please call 0414 752 800 between 9.30-4.30, Monday - Friday to book your place.
Requirements: Participants will need a scooter and a helmet. PSL can supply some scooters and helmets if needed. Please negotiate this when booking your place. It is preferred that participants wear protective knee and elbow pads if you have some.
Age: 10-17

Have fun paddling as a team in two-seat kayaks as you embark on one of the best ways to observe the Brisbane's hidden beauty. The guided kayak adventures are a great way to learn more about the local flora and wildlife of Brisbane waterways as well as having an experienced guide to help with kayaking skills. All associated kayaking and safety equipment supplied as well as light refreshments.

item.title: A Play In A Day!
item.description:
Tuesday, July 2, 2013, 10am – 4pm



Ever wondered what goes into creating a play? Wonder no more! In this exciting, fast moving workshop you will have the chance, to create with a play in a day with Goat Track Theatre Co. No we’re not kidding! You will think up, write, rehearse and then perform a play in just five hours. If you’re a young writer who would like to see your writing performed or a young performer who would like to learn how to put your own piece of theatre together, then this workshop is for you. The final outcome of the day will be the performance of a brand new piece of theatre, based on a topic to be decided on, by the group, on the day! That’s right from idea to world premiere in just five hours! Excited? You will be!

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings for this workshop will be taken via email - visibleinkvalley@brisbane.qld.gov.au - Please specify if you wish to be a Writer or a Performer.
Requirements: Bring all your creative ideas along! Parents are welcome to arrive from 3:30pm, to view the final performance piece at 3:50pm. Please bring lunch, as it is not supplied. Fruit and water will be provided.
Age: 10-17
Venue: Visible Ink Valley
Venue address: 5 Green Square Close, Fortitude Valley, QLD, 4006

item.title: StreetWise Learn To Skate Workshops - Beginners
item.description:
Deagon Skate Park, Kempster St, Deagon
Sunday, July 14, 2013, 9 – 11am



StreetWise Learn To Skate Workshops and Events is a fun, healthy and physical activity taught by dedicated Australia Sports Commission accredited skateboarders within the local scene. All equipment is provided such as skateboards and safety gear and activity is free. This activity is perfect for kids who have never skateboarded before and want to give it a go, or just to improve your skills and learn a few basic tricks.

Cost: Free
Bookings: Bookings Required. Please call 07 55 757 808 to book your place.
Requirements: Please wear a hat, sunscreen, sturdy footwear.
Age: 10-17
